name: 13ggs
description:
13ggs is a physics-art project made for an assignment; a reaction to The Kunsthalle Prague gallery's "KINETISMUS: 100 Years of Electricity in Art" exhibition (https://www.kunsthallepraha.org/en/events/kinetismus-100-years-of-electricity-in...).

How it "works"

The metal eggs are individually pulled up by electromagnets activated when their corresponding button is pressed. In this program those buttons are the keys on your keyboard.

The magnet shortly after deactivates and lets the egg drop back down.

Upon landing, the egg emits a sound. This sound could be anything, but for the sake of simplicity, the sounds emitted are piano keys.

Controls

(Controls different in browser version are in parentheses)

W E R T - Top row of eggs

S D F G -  Middle row of eggs

X C V B - Bottom row of eggs

Esc (Space) - Open menu

13th egg

In order to get to the 13th egg, you must click in the middle of the screen and enter the number "13". There is an invisible input field. It may take a couple of attempts.

G - Golden egg

Backspace - Return to Main Level

Asset Credits
  • 3D egg models: https://free3d.com/3d-model/egg-370117.html
  • Piano key sounds: https://freesound.org/people/jobro/packs/2489/
